page.title: 14KIRKHILL CEMETRY, PENICUIK
page.content: It was built in{1884}and the house for the caretaker added in{1888.}We estimated that there were between{300 {to 400 graves.}Several ex-provosts of Penicuik have been buried here. The largest grave is erected in memory of the{Cowan Family,}who were mill owners.There are a number for{soldiers {killed in World War 1,}mostly killed in France, and all very young boys. The most interesting grave is the one erected after the{Mauricewood Pit {Disaster of 1889,}with the names of 3 teenage boys,{Thomas Foster,Mitchell {Hamilton and Robert Tolmie}who died attempting to warn the miners of the fire danger. On our visit we sketched the more unusual designs of headstone and interviewed the{cemetry caretaker.
